result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Louis-Joseph Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Louis-Joseph Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Louis-Joseph Miller was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Mark Louis-Joseph Miller was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Louis-Joseph Miller

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Mark Louis-Joseph Miller in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Mark Louis-Joseph Miller.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that defendant to plead to Counts 2 and 3. Count 1 to be dismissed. For Count 2, 120 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 16 days jail with credit for 16 days, pay a $50 fine plus costs and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the Dept of Corrections. For Count 3, 30 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Concurrent to Count 2. Conditions of probation include 16 days jail with credit for 16 days and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the Dept of Corrections. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2 and 3. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 2, 120 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 16 days jail with credit for 16 days, pay a $50 fine plus costs and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the Dept of Corrections. Time to run consecutive to any other sentence if revoked. For Count 3, 30 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Concurrent to Count 2. Conditions of probation include 16 days jail with credit for 16 days and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the Dept of Corrections. Time to run consecutive to any other sentence if revoked. Count 1 is dismissed.

9:33 AM Defendant Mark Louis-Joseph Miller in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Mark Louis-Joseph Miller.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal notes agreement, asks for pleas and sentencing a few weeks out.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:34 AM Defendant Mark Louis-Joseph Miller in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Mark Louis-Joseph Miller.  Attorney Peter Kruger for Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1.
Stip and Order to Modify Bail Conditions
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim 1. The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Louis-Joseph Miller appeared by video, in custody. Court questions defendant of alternative address. Defendant states will stay in hotel until finding new place. Attorney Hoffman makes special appearance. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading, pleads not guilty on Count 2 and 3 and requests preliminary hearing on Count 1. State requests $1,000 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Victim 1. The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. Defendant has 2 pending warrants out of Michigan one for failure to report to jail. Unable to verify fta's but defendant has several felony priors.  Attorney Hoffman states defendant has lived in area for 1 year and family is out of Michigan. Defendant is employed at the refinery right now. Victim makes statement to the Court. Court reviews past history and lack of local contacts. Court orders $2,500 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Victim 1. The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
ID Key, Motion, and Order to Seal
